title: List of prime ministers of Canada - Wikipedia
snippet: The prime minister of Canada is the official who serves as the primary minister of the Crown, chair of the Cabinet, and thus head of government of Canada. Twenty-four people (twenty-three men and one woman) have served as prime minister. Officially, the prime minister is appointed by the governor general of Canada, but by constitutional convention, the prime minister must have the confidence of the elected House of Commons.

title: Prime Ministers of Canada
snippet: This page provides general details on Canada's prime ministers since 1867.

title: List of prime ministers of Canada | Britannica
snippet: Though the titular head of Canada is the reigning monarch of the United Kingdom (represented locally by a governor-general), the effective head of government is the prime minister. After a general election, the governor-general calls on the leader of the political party winning the most seats in the House of Commons to become prime minister and to form a government. This is a chronologically ordered list of the prime ministers, from the earliest to the most recent.

title: Government Ministries and Prime Ministers of Canada Since 1867 - House of Commons Procedure and Practice, Third edition, 2017 - ProceduralInfo - House of Commons of Canada
snippet: Since Confederation, there have been 28 Ministries. ... The government of Sir John A. Macdonald resigned on November 5, 1873, as a result of the Canadian Pacific Railway scandal. On November 7, 1873, the Liberals under Alexander Mackenzie formed a government. ... Sir John Abbott served as Prime Minister from the Senate.
